titleStmt.title: A distinct and faithful accompt of all the receipts, disbursments, and remainder of the moneys collected in England, VVales & Ireland, for the relief of the poor distressed Protestants in the valleys of Piemont, together with a brief accompt of the present state of affairs in those parts; as well for the better satisfaction of all those who have already contributed, as for the encouragement of those who have yet been wanting toward so good and charitable a work. Printed and published by special order of His Highness and the Council.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)

titleStmt.title: A distinct and faithful accompt of all the receipts, disbursments, and remainder of the moneys collected in England, VVales & Ireland, for the relief of the poor distressed Protestants in the valleys of Piemont, together with a brief accompt of the present state of affairs in those parts; as well for the better satisfaction of all those who have already contributed, as for the encouragement of those who have yet been wanting toward so good and charitable a work. Printed and published by special order of His Highness and the Council.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)
Vyner, Thomas, Sir, 1588-1665.
Packe, Christopher, Sir, 1593?-1682.
Morland, Samuel, Sir, 1625-1695.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Hen. Hills and John Field, Printers to His Highness,

notesStmt.note: Page 4 gives responsiblity for the collections to Sir Thomas Viner and Sir Christopher Parke.
Includes "An extract, or, abbreviate of the accompt delivered in to the hands of the Right Honorable Commissioners for the valleys of Piemont" by Samuel Morland.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
